TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HealthEvent extends System.Object

summary.para: Represents health information reported on a health entity, such as cluster, application or node, with additional metadata added by the Health Manager.

Docs.remarks: Health events are returned by health queries such as . They contain sent to Health Manager in a .

summary.para: Gets the health information that was sent to health store in a .

value.para: The health information that was sent to health store in a .

summary.para: Gets a value that indicates whether the health event has expired.

value.para: true if the health event has expired; false if the health event was not expired at the time the health store evaluated the query.

remarks.para: An event can be expired only if RemoveWhenExpired is false. Otherwise, the event is not returned by query and is removed from the store.

summary.para: If the current is , returns the time at which the health report was first reported with . For periodic reporting, many reports with the same state may have been generated.

If the current is or , returns the time at which the health state was last in , before transitioning to a different state. If the has never been , the value will be System.DateTime.FromFileTimeUtc(0).

value.para: Returns representing the last transition time (UTC) involving .

remarks.para:
The transition fields, , , give the history of the health state transitions for the event. They can be used for smarter alerts or "historical" health event information. They enable scenarios such as:
Alert when a property has been at warning/error for more than X minutes. This avoids alerts on temporary conditions. For example, an alert if the health state has been warning for more than five minutes can be translated into (HealthState == Warning and Now - LastWarningTransitionTime > 5 minutes).
Alert only on conditions that have changed in the last X minutes. If a report was already at error before the specified time, it can be ignored because it was already signaled previously.
If a property is toggling between warning and error, determine how long it has been unhealthy (i.e. not OK). For example, an alert if the property hasn't been healthy for more than five minutes can be translated into (HealthState != Ok and Now - LastOkTransitionTime > 5 minutes).

summary.para: Gets the date and time when the health report was last modified by the health store.

value.para: The date and time when the health report was last modified by the health store.

summary.para: If the current is , returns the time at which the health report was first reported with . For periodic reporting, many reports with the same state may have been generated.

If the current is or , returns the time at which the health state was last in , before transitioning to a different state. If the has never been , the value will be System.DateTime.FromFileTimeUtc(0).

value.para: Returns representing the last transition time (UTC) involving .

summary.para: Gets the date and time when the health report was sent by the source.

value.para: The date and time when the health report was sent by the source.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a string representation of the health event.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the health event.
